entry.title: Selenium WebDriver wait for new tab open
entry.content:
In some of case when you click in link or button , the new tab will be open.But we don’t know what time the tab will be open success. Take a look in this code to resolve this problem

```

/**
 * @param driver : this is webdriver
 * @param timeout : time you define to wait the tab open
 * @return true if tab open in the time , false if tab not open in the time.
 */

public static boolean waitForNewTab(WebDriver driver,int timeout){

    boolean check = false;
    int count = 0;
    while(!check){
        try {
            Set<String> winHandle = driver.getWindowHandles();
            if(winHandle.size() > 1){
                check = true;
                return check;
            }
            Thread.sleep(1000);
            count++;
            if(count > timeout){
                return check;
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
        }
    }
    return check;
}

```

entry.title: How to switch Driver to Tab/Window by Title tab?
entry.content:
In some case when you need to switch driver to the tab/window that you know the title of this, you can use this method below

``` public static WebDriver switchToTabByTitle(WebDriver driver , String title){

    Set<String> handles = driver.getWindowHandles();
    for(String handle : handles){
        driver.switchTo().window(handle);
        if(driver.getTitle().equals(title)){
            break;
        }
    }
    return driver;

} ```

entry.title: How to get the current browser running in real time with WebDriver
entry.content:
In some case of test automation , you need to find out Selenium WebDriver is running in which browser.

So take a look in this example code to know :

``` public String getCurrentBrowserName(WebDriver driver){

if(driver instanceof InternetExplorerDriver){
    return "IE browser";
}else if(driver instanceof FirefoxDriver){
    return "Firefox browser";
}else if(driver instanceof ChromeDriver){
    return "Chrome browser";
}

}

```
